meanings.definition: The state or quality of being irritating.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints about the weather were real irritancies.
meanings.sent2: The loud construction noise outside was causing a lot of irritancies.
meanings.sent3: The way he always hums off-key can be quite the irritancies.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet was an irritancies that echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of the mosquito near my ear was an irritancies I couldn't ignore.

meanings.sent1: The constant beeping of the alarm clock was one of the irritancies in his morning routine.
meanings.sent2: She tried to avoid all the little irritancies that came with working in a busy office.
meanings.sent3: The way the cat always knocks things off the table can be one of those irritancies that make you laugh.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jams were like irritancies that tested everyone's patience.
meanings.sent5: The squeaky door became one of those irritancies that you only notice when it's quiet.
